section.para: Searches for the re in the message.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
Searches for the first match of re and appends txt after it.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
Replaces the first occurrence of re with txt.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
Replaces re with repl (sed or perl like).
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: '/re/repl/flags' - sed like regular expression. flags can be a combination of i (case insensitive), g (global) or s (match newline don't treat it as end of line).

example.title: subst usage
example.programlisting: ... # replace the uri in to: with the message uri (just an example) if ( subst('/^To:(.*)sip:[^@]*@[a-zA-Z0-9.]+(.*)$/t:\1\u\2/ig') ) {}; ...

section.para: Runs the re substitution on the message uri (like subst but works only on the uri)
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: '/re/repl/flags' - sed like regular expression. flags can be a combination of i (case insensitive), g (global) or s (match newline don't treat it as end of line).

example.title: subst usage
example.programlisting: ... # adds 3463 prefix to numeric uris, and save the original uri (\0 match) # as a parameter: orig_uri (just an example) if (subst_uri('/^sip:([0-9]+)@(.*)$/sip:3463\1@\2;orig_uri=\0/i')){$ ...

section.para: Runs the re substitution on the message uri (like subst_uri but works only on the user portion of the uri)
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: '/re/repl/flags' - sed like regular expression. flags can be a combination of i (case insensitive), g (global) or s (match newline don't treat it as end of line).

example.title: subst usage
example.programlisting: ... # adds 3463 prefix to uris ending with 3642 (just an example) if (subst_user('/3642$/36423463/')){$ ...

Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

suffix - string (usually at least line terminator).

note.para: Takes header field names "as is" and doesn't distinguish compact names.
